title: Video: Renault's Japanese F1 GP disqualification explained
text:
The Renault Formula 1 team was expelled from the Japanese Grand Prix results after the FIA investigated a protest against its brake bias system launched by rivals Racing Point.

Although some of the protests - including a suggestion that it was a fully-automatic system - levelled against Renault by Racing Point were not all upheld, maintaining it had not broken the technical regulations, the FIA deemed that the system was a driver aid and hence was a breach of the sporting regulations.

But there's more to the case than meets the eye, and the decision to strip Daniel Ricciardo and Nico Hulkenberg of their points-scoring finishes comes amid a disappointing season for the team. This video explains the events as they unfolded so far.

Video: Renault's Suzuka disqualification explained More
